alert.note: Alert for Fremont (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued June 07 at 6:57PM MDT until June 08 at 12:00AM MDT by NWS Riverton
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL MIDNIGHT MDT TONIGHT FOR CENTRAL FREMONT COUNTY... At 657 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated showers and thunderstorms produced an estimated 2 to 3.75 inches of rain earlier today. The heaviest rain fell within about a 12 square mile area centered near Shotgun Butte, between Muddy and Sheep Creeks. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flooding of small creeks and streams, gravel roads, secondary roads, and backcountry roads, as well as poor drainage and low lying areas. Normally dry washes and draws are likely to be running full with water. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Muddy Creek and Sheep Creek drainages, Shotgun Butte Road, Harris Road, Arapahoe Ranch Road, and Mail Camp Road. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. Turn around, don`t drown! Remain alert for flooding even in locations not receiving rain. Arroyos, streams, and creeks can become raging currents in a matter of minutes, even from distant rainfall.
